message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this incredible product. It's a one-of-a-kind opportunity to own something truly unique. I believe it's worth a lot to you, and I'm willing to start the negotiation at a price of $2000000.

Alice,  $2000000 is way above my budget for this product. I'm very interested but I'm only able to offer $800000 at this time. This is my best offer and represents the maximum value I see in this product.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand that $800000 is a significant amount for you, but I'm afraid it's still below the value I have in mind. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer $1200000. This is a fair compromise, considering the product's unique features and benefits. I'm confident you'll find it a worthwhile investment.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $1200000 is still above my budget. I'm sticking with my initial offer of $800000.  This is a fair price that reflects the value I see in the product.  Let's see if we can reach an agreement.

I understand that you're sticking to your initial offer, Bob, but I'm not willing to go that low. I'm willing to make another compromise and offer $1100000. This is a fair price that still reflects the product's value, and I believe it's worth considering. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, but I need to know you're serious about making a deal.

Alice, I appreciate your flexibility, but $1100000 is still a bit high for me. I'm  sticking with my offer of $800000. I believe this is a fair price that reflects the value of the product, and I'm confident it's a deal we can both be happy with.  I'm ready to close if you're willing to accept.

I understand that you're sticking to your initial offer, Bob, but I'm not willing to sell the product for $800000. I'm willing to make one more compromise and offer $1050000. This is my final offer, and I'm willing to walk away if you're not willing to meet me in the middle. I believe this is a fair price that reflects the product's value, and I'm willing to give you one last chance to make a deal.
